result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Sarah E Butke was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Sarah E Butke was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs ($268) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge.
Maintain employment and/or comtination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Probram.
Apply 80 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Case 14CT1360.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $2,600 (payable to the victim M.S.) is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs or fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Big Bend Police Department.  DNA surcharge ($250) is assessed.  Costs and surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed during the period of Extended Supervision.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Fine ($3,801) is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

03/28/28 COURT ORDERS ANY UNPAID COSTS OR RESTITUTION FROM COUNT 2 TO BE CONTINUED TO BE PAID AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION ON COUNT 1. ANY REMAINING BALANCE ON EITHER COUNT WILL BE CONVERTED TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT AT TIME OF DISCHARGE FROM SUPERVISION.
